awd_titl_txt: CSEDI: Experimental, Seismological, and Modeling Study of   the Rheology, Structure, and State of Stress of Deep        Subducting Slabs
awd_abstract_narration: 96-29591  Green    The PIs propose an interdisciplinary study of the nature of deep  earthquakes.  This research  will test the validity of the proposed mechanism of  transformation-induced faulting that  accompanies the metastable phase change from olivine to spinel in  subducting lithospheric  slabs.  Laboratory microstructural and rheological experiments and  seismological studies will  be continued and will be enhanced by geodynamic modeling studies at  both laboratory  (micromechanical modeling of the transformation-induced  instability) and earth scales  (large-scale thermal and mechanical modeling).  Understanding the  failure mechanism of  deep earthquakes is important for determining the internal  mineralogical structure of  subducting slabs and identifying the driving forces for convection  in the earth's mantle.  ***
